intro: Satureja olla, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are lance-shaped and emit a strong, pungent fragrance when crushed. Satureja olla is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and antiseptic properties.
